title: An Effective Guide to Flow Chart Mapping
headline: This free online course will teach you how to create an effective flow chart to identify and solve problems.
description: Do you struggle to identify and resolve issues in your organisation? Without a visual picture of a process, it is difficult to figure out how it works, what drives it and why it can fail. Flowcharts are one of many visual representations of a process map. Discover how you can improve the process of your organisation with a flowchart. We'll also walk you through each step of creating a flowchart using live demonstrations.
courseDescription:
Are you interested in increasing the workflow efficiency of your process or project? One tool you should consider is a flowchart; a graphical or pictorial representation of a process. It highlights the important procedures for resolving an issue, given that every organisation faces challenges. How can we create a flow chart to address these issues? In this course, Robert Chapman, your instructor, will teach flowchart mapping straightforwardly, providing you with the right mindset, tools and technique to go into your next mapping session. It begins by introducing you to process mapping and its various benefits. We'll explore how to use the flowchart icons to create a flow chart and then discuss the scenario we'll use to build a simple process.

While flowcharts are an excellent method for clarity, they can also cause misunderstanding. We will guide you through a step-by-step process of designing and building an exemplary flowchart highlighting possible workflow issues and providing visual clarity of your process. Identifying your strategy is vital in creating a functional flowchart. Failure to precisely determine this process could lead you to map the incorrect areas. Discover how to identify the start and end, so you stay within its scope when mapping out your flowchart. In addition, you will learn how to recognise the trigger point for your process and its various departments.

Once you've finished building your flowchart, you should consider what to do with it. We include how to identify value and waste from your flowchart and how to conduct process improvements with it. We'll then show you a case study of how a process map was created and close out the course with hints and tips on how you can implement change effectively. We have packed the course with many demonstrations to aid your understanding of flowcharts. As a business owner, entrepreneur or project manager, you should always strive to increase the efficiency of your workplace. Organising your company's operations can also help your employees become more productive. And more productive employees yield more sales. Anyone can take this course. Enrol today!

Start Course Now

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Explain process mapping and its importance. 
    • Outline 4 advantages of process mapping.
    • List the advantages and disadvantages of using a flow chart. 
    • Recognise the different types of flow chart icons and their respective functions.
    • Discuss the processes that are involved in building a flow chart.
    • Summarise how to identify value and waste in a flow chart. 
    • Recall why validating a map is important.

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key contents covered in this module are:
    • Process mapping is, simply put, the step-by-step activity of mapping out your process. 
    • A flowchart is a simple graphical tool used for documenting the "flow" of a process - this is how something goes from the start to the finish of a process.
    • There is a process to follow when looking to map out your flowchart, and that is as follows: Identify your process, identify the key parameters of that process, identify the start and end of that process, identify the ke
